title: RoadGuard Vision
subtitle: COMPUTER VISION
desc: An AI-powered road damage detection system with real-time geolocating, multi-source video input, severity classification, and interactive mapping dashboard.

sections.title: Infrastructure at Risk
sections.content: Manual road inspections are labor-intensive, costly, and often overlook critical safety hazards. Municipalities need automated, scalable solutions to monitor road conditions across urban environments.

sections.title: YOLOv8 + ByteTrack
sections.content: Leveraging YOLOv8 trained on RDD dataset for multi-class damage detection. ByteTrack algorithm with IoU-based matching prevents duplicate detections and tracks objects across frames.

sections.title: Interactive Mapping
sections.content: Streamlit-based dashboard with Folium integration for real-time mapping. Features include heatmaps, cluster markers, live statistics, and export to CSV/GeoJSON/KML formats for GIS applications.

sections.title: Severity Classification
sections.content: Detections are classified by severity: High (Pothole, Alligator Crack), Medium (Longitudinal/Transverse Crack), and Low (Lane Marking issues). Each detection is geolocated via integrated GPS system.

sections.title: Customizable Parameters
sections.content: Fine-tune detection with adjustable confidence thresholds, IoU settings, and GPS modes. Supports multiple video sources including file upload, webcam, RTSP streams, and browser camera via WebRTC.

title: KopiChain Traceability
subtitle: BLOCKCHAIN
desc: An enterprise blockchain solution for Indonesian coffee exports with full traceability, digital payments, and quality certification across 5 organizations.

sections.title: Transparency Crisis
sections.content: Indonesian coffee exports lack traceability from farm to cup. Farmers receive unfair payments, quality data is unreliable, and stakeholders cannot verify the origin or handling of products.

sections.title: 5 Organizations, 1 Network
sections.content: Built on Hyperledger Fabric with five distinct organizations: Petani (Farmer), Logistik, Koperasi, Regulator, and Importir. Each has dedicated peers and endorsement policies requiring 3/5 consensus for validation.

sections.title: Chaincode in Go
sections.content: Smart contracts handle batch registration, GPS-tracked checkpoints, cupping score QC, residue testing, export approval, and automated payment settlements with 80/20 farmer-cooperative splits.

sections.title: Full Traceability
sections.content: Track every batch from harvest to import with immutable records. GPS checkpoints, temperature monitoring, quality scores, and digital wallet transactions all recorded on-chain.

sections.title: Web-Based Data Entry
sections.content: As a simulation project, all supply chain data is entered through the React dashboard. Each stakeholder (Farmer, Logistics, Cooperative, Regulator, Importer) has dedicated interfaces to record their activities on the blockchain.

title: ETL Stock Dashboard
subtitle: DATA ENGINEERING
desc: A fully containerized ETL pipeline for Indonesian stock market data with real-time scraping, sentiment analysis, and interactive visualization dashboard.

sections.title: Data Fragmentation
sections.content: Stock market data is scattered across multiple sources—IDX, financial news portals, and global exchanges. Manual collection is time-consuming and prone to inconsistencies.

sections.title: Automated ETL Pipeline
sections.content: Built a modular ETL system using Apache Airflow for orchestration. Each component—Extract, Transform, Load—runs in isolated Docker containers for scalability and fault tolerance.

sections.title: Multi-Source Extraction
sections.content: Scrapers pull data from IDX (Indonesian Stock Exchange), IQPlus (financial news with sentiment), and Yahoo Finance (global market data). All processes run on scheduled DAGs.

sections.title: Real-Time Visualization
sections.content: Interactive Next.js dashboard displaying stock prices, historical trends, and news sentiment. Data served via FastAPI backend connected to MongoDB.

title: Smart City Energy Monitor
subtitle: IOT & BIG DATA
desc: An IoT-based energy monitoring system for multi-district urban areas with real-time visualization, sensor management, and time-series analytics powered by Apache Cassandra.

sections.title: Sustainable Development Goals
sections.content: Aligned with SDG 7 (Clean Energy) and SDG 11 (Sustainable Cities). The system enables cities to monitor, analyze, and optimize energy consumption across multiple districts in real-time.

sections.title: Distributed System Design
sections.content: Built with Apache Cassandra for time-series data storage, Spring Boot REST API for backend services, and Next.js for the interactive dashboard. Python simulator generates realistic IoT sensor data.

sections.title: Raw CQL Implementation
sections.content: Following the golden rule of no ORM—all database interactions use raw CQL via CqlSession and PreparedStatement for maximum performance and control over Cassandra queries.

sections.title: Interactive Monitoring
sections.content: Real-time maps with sensor markers, district filtering, and status-based color coding. Analytics dashboard shows energy trends, solar vs grid distribution, and inter-district comparisons.

sections.title: Real-Time Data Simulation
sections.content: Since physical IoT sensors are not available, real-time sensor data is simulated using a Python-based data generator. The simulator produces realistic energy readings (kWh, voltage) with configurable intervals, mimicking actual sensor behavior across multiple districts.
